description:
It's finally here. Not only have we got the 100th issue of the greatest comic book on earth, we have the most incredible battle between the Silver Surfer and Mephisto ever! Don't miss the soulshattering saga. Brought to you by Ron Marz, Joe Phillips and Tom Christopher.

Summary
Mephisto has finally obtained the Silver Surfer's soul. The Surfer believes he has been cheated, for it was his soul he pledged to Nova, not Mephisto. But it matters not, the soul belongs to Mephisto and he takes them to Hell.

He informs the Surfer that he is now his for all eternity and values the Surfer's soul more than he once thought. He brings the Surfer to a pit of billions of Mephisto's lost souls, and among them are both of the Surfer's parents. This is more than the Surfer can handle to see and he attacks Mephisto.

Mephisto uses his minions at first before joining in the battle. But the Surfer continues to deny him and increase his power. He is able to kill Mephisto and free his parents souls, but they leave the Surfer alone and shattered by the experience.

Mephisto, who is far from dead, is pleased over the outcome of his plans, leaving the Surfer with a defeat that will haunt him for eternity.
name: Mephisto

description: The Vision’s erratic behavior reaches new heights when he attacks fellow Avengers Giant-Man and Crystal. Will Vision achieve humanness only to see it slip away? Deathcry, Jocasta, and Ultron held captive by the avenging automaton, but for what purpose?
name: Visionary Dreams
What if Stryfe Killed the X-Men

description: KWAI's mortally wounded! MOTHER needs a dupe, and finds MASQUERADE!
name: Some Dissembly Required
Some Like It... Not!

description: MOTHERSHIP CONNECTION, Conclusion - Hardware makes a guest appearance as Rocket struggles to deal with Icon's imminent departure, while DMZ decides whether or not to join him on his return journey home.
name: If You Ain't Gonna Get It On...

description: Hardware makes a special appearance after Kobalt and Page are dubbed "Dakota's newest super-hero sensation" by the media. And a small-time crook may be the key to St. Cloud's stash of illegal imports...or the bait to lure Kobalt into a deadly trap!
name: Repercussions

description: While the abandoned Shadow Cabinet battles on, Dharma begins to recruit new members. Among them are Starlight, a living source of electromagnetic radiation, and Payback, the villainous monster from Icon's first adventure. Meanwhile, Plus, assumed to be missing in action, learns more about her captors, the formidable Union of Separatist Scientists and their leader, Captain Ray.
name: Red Death Part 3: Wheep Wheep

description:
WHAT ARE LITTLE BOYS MADE OF? - Part 4 of 5. Dakota becomes a war zone of anti-gay violence as the Sons of Odin make a ferocious reappearance, forcing Static to intervene and enter into a fiery confrontation with one of his oldest enemies.

Virgil and Frieda argue about his attitude towards Rick. Virgil has a lot to consider about his prejudice. A mysterious girl watches Static fly home. Virgil has to miss school because he is really sick. Daisy, Frieda and Rick decide to go to a gay rights activist convention. The convention is attacked by a racist group, Sons of Odin. Static arrives to confront the leader who turns out to be...Hotstreak!
name: Between A Rick And A Hard Place

story_arc_credits.name: What Are Little Boys Made Of?

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: What Are Little Boys Made Of?

description: Part 2 of the 6-part 'School of Anguish.' Following his strange encounter with Manuel Dexterity, Xombi becomes the target of Painful Inscriptions, the Beli Mah cult's bizarre agents of anguish and death. Xombi falls victim to beings like Bludgeon, who was crafted from misdirected rage, and Blister Ed, a construct of words spoken in anger.
name: Burning Sensation

description:
A Human named Elona becomes ensnared in one of Mantricker's nets, so he cuts her free. When she falls and sees him, she instantly falls inlove with him. Nothing that he can do can deter her affections from being poured into him.

She returns to her human village, where she begins to gossip about the gentlemanly qualities of the elf that she met. It is another thing that has improved human-elf relations, but her father suppresses her testimony and turns human-love sexual relations into a taboo on the world of two moons.
name: Hero Worship

description:
ElfQuest: Shards #4 takes place at the same time as this issue of Newblood. The tribe has split into two groups, one led by Cutter (SHARDS), and this group led by Ember and Leetah.
In this issue, the Wolfriders journey through the outskirts of the forest and into the savannah region. They travel to finally find "HOWLING ROCK", the craggy grotto which would become their temporary Holt to dwell.
The greatest issue of this episode is the overwhelming starvation of the tribe, which finally ends when the tribe kills several birds and small game. They have a feast.
name: MOUSE HUNT

description:
"HEAD" is kept safely in the free vault of elfquest comics at http://www.elfquest.com/gallery/OnlineComics3.html

In this episode, Kahvi becomes strong enough to visit her dad Rayek in the magickal SHARDroom. Two-Edge has fallen in love with her at this point and is reluctant to have her leave. He begins to keep a watchful ear as to her movements.

Cutter's force continues to battle and destroy How-Ünds.
name: HEAD

description:
After saving his life in ElfQuest: Jink #2, Kullyn Kenn enjoys a groveside romp with Jink. While the couple is cleaning up, Jink confesses to Kenn that she has not known a romantic partner in over one hundred years. She escapes into the mysts, and hereinafter must Kullyn Kenn balance having an elven lover and a human lover Tamia Korhat.

Meanwhile, far far away, the sheer judo prowess of the military skill from the Neverending is demonstrated. The plans to conquer the human-inhabited Abode are detailed, and they have synchronous underpinnings with the movements of Jerrod Anaken, who is being controlled by "the black snake".
name: NEVERENDING STORY

description: This issue: witness Ripjak decimating an entire planetary civilization! When the villian continues to elude them, the Guardians elect a new team leader --- one who will eliminate the menace once and for all!
name: Show Me A Hero And I Will Write You A Tragedy

description: Split up and in a desperate fight for their lives! Gunny and Sirot's suits have lost power, James is cornered by the Spider Aliens, and Cordova and Aric have been captured. The chance of victory is slim, will the Armorines be able to pull through and escape from the Spider Alien's grasp?!
name: Sacrifices

person_credits.name: David Mack
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description:
Something's in the air, and Susan's mistaken it for love. Having returned to her hometown after a decade absent, she's reunited with Avril, and romance from days past is reawakened. But Susan's town is now run by a gang of punks called Orion's Bastards, and Avril is under their jurisdiction. They're looking to shatter the romance just as they've crushed the once-quaint town. Will they succeed in destroying love's young dream? Or will the blood on their hands be their own?

Also in this issue: "Babylon Crash, Part 2." The latest installment of Matt Wagner's fully painted epic, Devil Quest, opens the doors of the Khan's palace, revealing an empire in its last, sordid days. Jupiter III seeks salvation in his quest for the devil, but he may end up finding his destruction instead.

Back at Avril's home a romance between Susan and Avril is rekindled. Susan and Avril recount their pasts, Avril telling a story of how Susan had hurther as a young child. Susan realizes that Avril works for the Bastards and is hooked on their drugs. Susan urges Avril to go away with her, leaving it all behind. Avril relents, and Susan leaves to gather supplies.

Neither Susan nor Avril realized that the Bastards were monitoring them in Avril's home. While Susan was gone Buster, the leader of the Bastards, and some of his thugs arrived at Avril's home. The beat her severely and left her for dead. Susan arrives just in time to have Avril die in her arms.
name: Part 2; Babylon Crash Part 2

description:
1. The Big Picture (full text article by Dave about self publishing)

2. Minds Part 4
Cerebus sees himself when he was younger, and he recalls an incident wih a kitchen knife : he took it out of the house and Trevor stabbed him with it. This scared him because he got his sweater all bloody and he might get in trouble for taking it without permission. Cerebus' father and Magus Doran the wizard talk about Cerebus and it's agreed that Cerebus will be Doran's apprentice.

3. Red River preview (by Stephen Blue)
name: Mothers and Daughters 40 : Minds Part 4

description:
While battling Legion in the Negev Desert, the X-Men are transported back in time!

Continued from X-Factor #109. Legion is in Israel and is sane. That's a bad thing because he is ten times more powerful than his father Professor X and his actions seem to be quite hostile. The X-Men, PLO, and Israeli armies attempt to stop him but can't phase him. He takes Storm back in time to Egypt and forces her to watch the plane that killed her mother crash into her building. The X-Men try to pump Bishop full of energy to take on Legion, but instead the team anchors themselves and all are taken with Legion back in time to where he intends to help make Xavier's dream become a reality. In the Shi'ar Empire, Jahf the Watcher delivers a cryptic message to Lilandra: the end of all that is. Story continues in X-Men #40.
name: Legion Quest Part 1: The Son Rises In The East

description:
Aquaman gets a new costume and uncovers clues to his past as he seeks out Ocean Master's mother. Meanwhile, Aqualad searches for the mysterious woman he believes is Tula.

An Inupiat village is having trouble with a sea monster, while back at Pearl Harbor Aquaman, Aqualad, and Dolphin return to confront Strom. However upon arriving are told that Strom has never been at this base, and the base has never been flooded. Aquaman then settles on seeking out his father Atlan the wizard for answers. Meanwhile the young man Koryak manages to escape the sea monster following wounding it. He then returns to his village, letting his mother know he feels responsible for the monsters torment.

At the Aquacave, Aquaman and Dolphin recover with Dolphin questioning Aquaman's reluctance to sleep, as she kisses a surprised Aquaman who accidently cuts her. While Aqualad returns to Atlantis to question Vulko on his seeing of Tula, learning the legend of Atlantean wizards who had long ago mastered raising the dead. Meanwhile the sea monster once again returns, dragging several villagers to their watery death much to Koryak's anger. Aquaman and Aqualad then enter into a argument when Aquaman once again shuts Aqualad out before Aqualad can ask him for his assistance, with Dolphin leaving with Aquaman much to Garths sadness. Aquaman and Dolphin then ride to Alaska as Dolphin ponders over Garth's safety, while Aqualad picks up some new equipment to assist him in his journey.

Aquaman and Dolphin then arrive in Alaska, where he begins his search for Kako, where he meets her son Koryak. Who attacks him from behind knocking him through a window, trying to kill him with a harpoon. The fight is ultimately broken up by Kako, who reveals Koryak is his son.
name: Out Cold

description: Going Sane, Part 3 of 4. Recovering from a nearly lethal attack by his archnemesis, Batman resumes his search for the Joker. But the trail leads the Dark Knight unexpectedly to Joseph Kerr, a contented, well-adjusted man who seems too utterly sane to be the maniac Batman seeks.
name: Going Sane, Part 3: Breaking the Surface

volume.name: Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight

description:
Sabretooth makes an unwanted appearance! Wolverine and Ghost Rider face a supernatural threat when the ghost of Ogun returns. But why has Ogun’s spirit not been laid to rest?

Wolverine returning to back to NYC and heading toward the Xavier institute on his motorcycle is confronted by Ghost rider who waits for him at a fork in the road waiting for him to arrive. Ghost rider informs Wolverine that their is mystical energy in the air and can hear Wolverine's name being called by some unknown forces. Wolverine tells Ghost rider that he is not intrigued and to give him a reason to go with Ghost rider rather then go home. Ghost Rider utters a single word to Logan, "Ogun," which causes Wolverine to drive off with Ghost Rider to the source of the emanations.

Ghost rider and Wolverine arrive at the front doors of a Museum and enter only to find the guards dead or unconscious as they look for answers. Wolverine while looking around in the museum is reminded of the time he 1st met Ogun and moments of tutelage under Ogun, his master. while distracted both Ghost Rider and Wolverine hear a noise in the samurai section of the museum and discover armor missing. Wolverine notices the demon mask wore by his master in a display case and informs Ghost Rider he had destroyed it, Ghost rider explains that some mystical items of wizards cannot be so easily destroyed. once again they hear a noise and are drawn to it, Wolverine soon realizing that they are being purposely distracted heads back to the samurai section for the Demon Ogun Mask.

A portion of Ogun's spirit wearing samurai armor and the demon mask stands before wolverine and asks Wolverine if he remembers his past lessons while Ogun flashes his sword at Wolverine before tossing it in the air. Wolverine stands watching Ogun only to be drawin into an old memory remembering Ogun performing the same moves while teaching Wolverine.

Ogun stares at Wolverine and tells him to attack him that he is unharmed, Wolverine trying to recall just what happen after recovering from the memory realizes that Ogun had a sword.. Ghost Rider watching both men whips his chain stopping the sword from landing on Wolverine's head. Wolverine reaches up and catches the sword and walks toward Ogun having solved the riddle.

Ogun stands before Logan waiting for an answer as Logan calmly slashes between the mask cutting it even and answering the question his master had asked him long ago. Ogun's armor collapses on the floor empty, Wolverine standing over the mask and armor he states that this time it was the man, not the animal who won this day. The final lesson from a Master and a Student or possibly one final joke.
name: The Mask Of Ogun

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Shard helps Bishop track down Mountjoy in the city.
name: One Man Posse

description:
The birth of Genesis! Cable's son has completed his villainous transformation, and holds his father captive in the fortress of Apocalypse! It's up to Storm and Domino to break Cable out- but does he have what it takes to bring down his own son?

Cable surrenders himself to Genesis so that his teammates can "escape." They are really telepathically told to find him through a conveyed homing beacon. Genesis plans to use Cable to siphon energy and become the next Apocalypse. Cable's team trashes the place, however, and Cable opens his heart to his son. Genesis sees the truth but cannot commit to returning to America with Cable. The fortress explodes and a mysterious figure crawls from the ashes.
name: The Dark Ride Part 3: In The Name of the Father

description:
A Parisian museum is Catwoman's next target, where she must overcome a sophisticated security system to retrieve a fake painting.

Catwoman is in Paris to case a score. Her next assignment for the agency with no name is a painting in a museum. That painting is in fact a fake. The agency already has the original in its possession and it is intended to be recovered in a stolen art bust in Hong Kong three months from now.

The only thing not accounted for is the vault in which the painting is kept...
name: Thief Of Paris

description: Standing in for Bruce Wayne,Dick is captured by the Tally Man,only to find out that he was mistaken for Jean Paul Valley. The assault Azreal did to Tally Man made him come back for revenge and he made sure that the Batman will pay the price for it. During his captivity,memories from his early days linger from his mind,From his days in the circus upto the day the Titans rejoiced his leadership,even the day when the love of Starfire went cold on him. Managing to free himself,he faced Tally Man and nabs his assiliant in the process.
name: Falls Upon Prodigal: Part Ten

description:
Following the revelation of the identity of the villain responsible for the body in Superman's tomb, Metropolis comes under siege by swarming bizarre, unfathomable beasts.

While Brainiac fights the Forever People to escape from New Genesis, the Daily Planet family attends the funeral of Keith’s mother. Brainiac creates a surrogate, a female creature with an exposed brain, that turns others into her brain creatures. These brain creatures attack Superman, but only he can see them. The rest of the people of Metropolis believe Superman is going insane. The surrogate possesses Lois Lane, intent on trying to trick Superman into killing her. Lois, though, resists, and forces her possessed body to hug Superman. Superman, knowing the body he is hugging is familiar, realizes that whoever is responsible for Superman’s recent madness is trying to make him kill Lois. The creature possessing Lois is expelled, and Superman and Lois face the true threat behind the Dead Again! story arc.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe 25" "What Exactly Does an Inker Do?"a one page text piece with four panels of the same artwork. The first panel is the penciller's work the next three panels are inked by three different inkers to show the different styles of ink work on the artwork. The artwork was penciled by Jim Balent and inked by Scott Hanna, Gerry Fernandez and Jed Hotchkiss. The artwork was from Detective Comics #660.
  • Triangle 1995 #1.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #705.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman #96.
name: Mind Games

description: Superboy attacks Anima, thinking Anima is an agent of the Nameless One. Anima convinces Superboy that they are on the same side, against the Nameless One, who has essentially conquered the world. The Nameless One sends Eris and Anima’s brother Jeremy Mason against Superboy and Anima. At first, Anima is reluctant to fight, but soon figures out that Superboy is in fact the host of another Archai, the Warrior. Anima releases the Warrior from Superboy in much the same way that she releases Animus from herself. Superboy, Anima, and the Warrior defeat Eris, and Anima rescues her brother Jeremy.
name: Youth Against Fascism

description:
Overview

In the tropical paradise of Jamaica, things are not as picturesque as the travel brochures would suggest. Sent to stop a notorious arms dealer called Rifle, James Bond once again finds more than he bargained for. Rifle's clients turn out to be Elias Hazlewood and the Disciples of the Heavenly Way, a successful televangelist operation. Among the Way's membership is Maximillian "Quasimodo" Steel, a reformed mercenary. He's got a plan to stop the Beast and further God's cause. That is, unless James Bond can stop him first.

Live Wire fears that his powers are out of control and it may only be a matter of time before they erupt with lethal consequences. Plus, more is revealed about the mysterious rival super-team.

The Legion meets Winath's official representative for the Legion - Spark, twin sister of Live Wire. The Legion is surprised Live Wire is being replaced by his own government, until they learn that he's marked as an official runaway. President Chu doesn't care which Winathian stays on the team, as long as the Legion picks just one. Frustrated by the situation, Live Wire flies off the handle when he catches a meta named Ultra Boy spying on the Legion and his sister with his x-ray vision. The pair get into a tussle, causing property damage until other Legionnaires can break up the two. Seeing the destruction he's caused and feeling he does more harm than good, Live Wire solves the Winathian problem for the Legion by quitting.
name: Sibling Rivalry

description: HANDS OF THE MANDARIN tie-in! Force Works fights the deadly Avatars of Mandarin!
name: Pain and Penalties

description: Hell is just minding it's business when the legions of Heaven attack.
On the run from Caldone's men, Gilad's leap of faith leads to bullets ("BRAAAAAP!"), bloodshed (at least one sword-through-the-head!), and a high speed city chase that'd make Hal Needham blush!
name: The Immortal War - Part 3:  A Friend In Need

description: Clay's cousin, Elyot Zorn, has forced Clay to come for a "visit." How will things turn out between the Geomancer and his jealous cousin? In the mean time, could Clay's old partner from the force be in danger?
name: Ties That Bind

description:
When Magnus discovers that some guards were secretly sent by Minister Stimpert (who is possessed by the Immortal Enemy) to kill him, he then has to secretly make his way back home while Torque and Slagger continue their quest to find Armstrong and make him the new geomancer in “The Geomancer Quest Part Two – The Snows of Triton.”  
 
With Sneak Peek Card.
name: The Geomancer Quest - Part 2: The Snows Of Triton

description:
1st appearance:
- Photon
name: Farewell

description:
Ivar arrives in 1854 Sevastopol, on the eve of a massacre. As the Crimean War races forward, the Timewalker attempts to halt the Charge of the Light Brigade at the Battle of Balaclava. But, as the British stand against his prophecies, Ivar is challenged to a deadly duel: pistols at dawn with Captain Louis Nolan!

Time: 23 October 1894, & 2033.
name: The Enemy Is There

description: When some old enemies of Turok bust out of prison, Turok and company try to help locate and recapture them.
name: Nest Of Snakes

description:
A sudden appearance by a masked and caped stranger, trailing destruction and disaster in his wake has the heroes of the Valiant Universe on alert. X-O Manowar and the Armorines converge on L.A., both determined to find the identity of The Visitor and end his quest before the world is destroyed. Meanwhile, what is Toyo Harada's interest in The Visitor? Could the master manipulator be behind the battle in Los Angeles?

Released before the Visitor regular series.
name: A Stranger In A Strange Land

volume.name: The Visitor Vs. the Valiant Universe

description:
Flip book w/ "Edna, Queen of the Congo #1." Cover art by Bill Morrison. I Shrink, Therefore I'm Small, script by Gary Glasberg, pencils by Luis Escobar, inks by Tim Bavington; Homer is tricked into shrinking down and clearing an internal blockage in Mr. Burns body; Parody of Issac Asimov's Fantastic Voyage story. Matt Groening discusses writing blurbs for cartoonists he digs and gives examples. Bill Morrison biography. Jungle Bungle, script and inks by Bill Morrison, pencils by Bill Morrison (layout) and Luis Escobar; Edna as a Jungle Heroine.

  1. I Shrink, Therefore I'm Small
  2. My Life as a Blurb Machine (text article by Matt Groening)
  3. Junk Mail (letters column)
  4. Bongo Profile: Bill Morrison
  5. Edna, Queen of the Congo
  6. Jungle Bungle
name: I Shrink, Therefore I'm Small

description:
Eddie Campbell's critically acclaimed Eyeball Kid returns to grace the pages of DHP in this, the first installment of his all-new, six-part saga titled, "The Picture of Doreen Grey." Terry LaBan continues his Cud capers with his second episode of "Eno & Plum," as we peek into the lives of a couple from today's younger generation who have absolutely nothing to say! "Too Much Coffee Man" continues his hell-bent adventures in the third chapter by Shannon Wheeler.

Chapters

  • The Picture of Doreen Grey - Part 1
  • Too Much Coffee Man Meets His Coffee Maker - Part 3
  • Eno and Plum - Part 2
name: The Picture of Doreen Grey; Too Much Coffee Man; Eno & Plum

description: Dwight's got a mean mob operative on his tail and five dead cops bobbing in the tar pits like bruised apples. He knows if they aren't submerged before trigger boy shows up, those body-bagged boys in blue will become bargaining chips for the mob. Will Dwight walk away one step ahead of the mob? Or will the mob walk away with one head as evidence? Things are coming to a boil in The Town Without Pity and Dwight's loadin' up his guns for The Big Fat Kill.

volume.name: Sin City: The Big Fat Kill

description: Luke is racing to the far side of the galaxy to obtain a Jedi Holocron rumored to be on the planet Ossus. The power and knowledge that ancient device holds could give him just the edge he needs to defeat the evil Empire! But the Emperor has heard these rumors, too, and has sent a platoon of battle-hungry Dark Siders to bring the Holocron back to him. Fire up the lightsaber, Luke! It's gonna be a long night!
name: World of the Ancient Sith

description:
Overview

The Krath are tearing through the galaxy, laying claim to any inhabitable planets they come across, and they're crushing anyone who stands in their way! But Ulic Qel-Droma isn't just anyone; he's a Jedi, perhaps the greatest of his time. Ulic poses as a fallen Jedi turned smuggler in an effort to infiltrate the Krath, figuring the best way to stop their tour of terror is from the inside.
name: Sith Secrets

volume.name: Star Wars: Tales of the Jedi - Dark Lords of the Sith

description:
At precisely midnight, 100 crimes are committed by 100 criminals - too many even for Superman to cope with! Plus, 'Lock continues to offer help to the enchanted Babe and Jimmy Olsen.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe 27" "Desktop Publishing"a one page photo piece featuring the desk of editor Frank Pittarese with various sketches and notes on the upcoming Showcase 95 series.
  • Triangle 1995 #7.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman #97.
  • Chronological continuation in Action Comics #707.
name: Christmas Thieves

description: His body destroyed, Animal Man's consciousness is drawn into 'the Red,' the plane of existence where all animal life intersects. A mysterious being in the form of Buddy's mother offers him a choice of two futures.
name: Homecoming

description: The fallen angel of “KnightsEnd,” Azrael, get's his own ongoing series by Denny O'Neal. Haunted by his disgrace and by nightmarish visions of the true Batman, Jean-Paul Valley wanders the streets until unforeseen circumstances unleash Azrael.
name: Fallen Angel: Some Say in Fire...

description: "Troika" part 1! A new era begins for the Dark Knight as Bruce Wayne adopts a fearsome new look for his battle against a group of former KGB operatives. The Dark Knight's first encounter with the "Troika" turns into a savage clash with the Cossack. Continued in BATMAN: SHADOW OF THE BAT #35.
name: Troika 1: Dark Rider, Cold Warrior

description:
Part 2 of the 3-part 'The Artificial Heart.' Convinced that Tim Hunter is in love with Marya, a jealous Daniel decides to help Slaggingham's make a hell of Tim's life. And an unsuspecting Auberon wanders into Slaggingham's plans.

Auberon, king of Faerie, is bored. Leaving Titania, who doesn’t care for him any more, he leaves Faerie altogether.

Daniel decides to work for Slaggingham. The Reverend used to beat him in the old days, when Daniel was working the streets, but now they both want revenge on the business world above. Slaggingham is building a machine to use against them, which will steal the happiness of the surface world. He also has Awn the Blink and the Queen of the Buggers, figments of Tim’s imagination made real when he was a child, to help out. The unicorn, last seen appearing near BillHunter when he was a drunk, sabotages part of the machine and runs off as Slaggingham fires at it. Slaggingham blames Tim for the unicorn; Daniel blames Tim for stealing Marya.

Kara lends Tim some money for ice cream, but Nikki takes his magic stone as collateral. She explains that it is an opening stone, but since he’s an opener himself, it works too well, and he needs to learn to do magic on his own. She says she’ll give it back when he doesn’t need it. They also tell him that Nikki woke his dad up and started to heal him.

Auberon, remembering medieval England, decides to go back, but is shocked at the changes since. He happens upon Sister Staylace, who is trying to steal a man’s soul, but it looks like she’s in danger. Auberon pushes away the man. She tricks him into putting his soul into her globe, and controls him, calling him “Lovey-horns.” She plans to put him to work for Slaggingham.

Daniel and Slaggingham, who we see is a cyborg, use his technology to spy on Marya. Daniel sees her with Tim and is incensed.

Tim manages to figure out how to unfreeze the girls in time. Tim and Molly come to terms with him being her boyfriend, and him being a magician, and then Molly sees the unicorn—until Daniel, transformed by Slaggingham’s machine, almost kills it with his new soot dust power.
name: The Artificial Heart, Book II: Bleak Houses, Hard Times

description: Part 3 of the 5-part 'Fragments,' in which one possible origin of Damage is explored. Damage's search comes to an abrupt halt when he defies a court order and returns to Atlanta, determined to save his friend Mandra from the deadly shape-changer Splatter. Written by Tom Joyner, with art by Bill Marimon and Don Hillsman. Plus, the Iron Munro tie-in story, "The Phantom Imperative," by Joyner, Jason Armstrong and Andrew Pepoy, reaches its exciting conclusion.
name: Links

description: Part 4 of the 4-part 'Imagine Ari's Friends': In the series finale, the Doom Patrol must save the world from the False Healers and Rabbi of Darkness by finding its own true healing.
name: Imagine Ari's Friend part 4:A Cry For the Great Face

description:
As the Justice League gets closer to penetrating the secret of Mount Thunder, a strike force trained by Captain Atom is sent to remove them at any cost. Plus, a former member of the League comes seeking help from his old comrades--before his time runs out.

Captain Atom, Blue Beetle, Maxima Amazing Man and Booster Gold are gathered in a secret military base and a couple United States special task forces are assigned to take them out. The first one is convinced to leave the other one is more than willing to fight and kill. As the team struggles to make sense of the base they are attacked by the second team who appear to be robots and they apparently kill Captain Atom.

Meanwhile Firestorm is looking for the Justice League at it's destroyed base. He bumps into Oberon and Skeets. Skeets had been in the rubble only moments before Firestorm arrived. Oberon and Skeets offer to help him find the rest of the league. Firestorm is hoping someone in the Justice League will be able to help him cure his cancer.
name: Mad Dogs and Superheroes!

description: Trapped in the Dreadlands after destroying Kingdom's dimensional gateway, Fate discovers that the Horde's master has mystically transformed Jared Stevens's ex-wife into a human portal for bridging dimensions. As the conclusive battle between Fate and Kingdom is taken to Earth, Stevens must choose between leaving the world open to invasion…or killing the woman he still loves.
name: Across the Great Divide

description: Flash, Impulse, Max Mercury and Jesse Quick take the fight to Kobra, racing against time to stop the criminal's scheme.
name: Terminal Velocity, Mach 4: Hit and Run

description:
High above Rockefeller Center, the last Green Lantern tests his mettle against the awesome magnetic powers of Doctor Polaris.

It's Christmas and Kyle is late for teen titans training and monitor duty. Arsenal chews him out and he learns the identity of all his teammates. Donna bids him goodbye to spend Christmas with her son. Kyle is left on monitor duty while his mind wonders off to Alex. He decides to take a fly around the city where he sees dr. Polaris causing trouble he defeats him and turns him over to the authorities. He gets all the love and adoration he has always wanted from the crowd so he heads back to titans tower. Donna comes back and hands him a gift, its mistletoe. And they share their first kiss.
name: Polaris

description:
The Female Furies and Boss Moxie kidnap the clones of the original Newsboy Legion. Flip, Famous Bobby and Yango go after them and crashed in mid-flight with the Whiz Wagon. This created a battle between the Female Furies, the Newsboy Legion, Project Cadmus and others.    
 
The battle ends with Boss Moxie falling down a cavern that Gilotina made as she switches sides and joined Project Cadmus. At the bottom of the cavern Boss Moxie is discovered by Dabney Donovan who promises to make him into something new.
name: Race the Devil

description: Part 4 of the 4-part 'Eyes of the Hawk.' An old foe with powers that rival Hawkman's returns, determined to destroy the Winged Warrior! But this villain has something to reveal to Katar Hol: the final secret of Hawkman's rebirth.
name: Eyes of the Hawk, Part 4: Sting of the Viper

description: Searching for the force that's threatening the corporeal plane, Constantine travels to Philadelphia accompanied by the ghost of Sir Francis Dashwood and the cat-demon Murnarr, where he encounters the Church of Virtual Reality and learns a disturbing secret. "Warped Notions" part 2.
name: Warped Notions, Part Two: The Everything Virus

description:
In part 2 of the 4-part "Arcadia," the Invisibles send their psychic bodies back to 18th century France to meet the Marquis de Sade while a time-traveling assassin tracks down their physical bodies in the present!

King Mob's Invisible cell has traveled to France during the Revolution. Despite the carnage surrounding them, and Jack's confusion; King Mob first comment is about how bad the people smell. He informs the group that they need to meet their contact, who will lead them to the person they're supposed to extract. Lord Fanny asks who they're extracting. KM replies that they're to pick up Donatien Alphonse Francoise aka the Marquis deSade.

They find their contact, Etienne, performing a spell in a nearby house. He is surprised to find that his ritual actually worked. Etienne loads them into a wagon to take them to the Marquis. He explains a little about the current situation of the French Revolution, and also about some strange events that have been occurring: Lights in the sky, and some "thing" eating the dead bodies in the mass graves.

At another point in time, Mary Shelley rides in a coach with her young children. She is reading a letter from her husband, Percy, when a dark-haired stranger interrupts her. The stranger asks her if she is Percy Shelley's wife and pulls an apple out of his bag; offering it to her.

Meanwhile, King Mob's crew is still on their way in the wagon. Etienne expresses frustration about all the subterfuge necessary for the Invisible College, and remarks how difficult it is to keep track of who's working for which side. Jack is suffering from ill effects due to this being his first trip back in time and feels physically ill. Boy comforts him, and tells everyone that something is wrong. King Mob tries to tell her that Jack can't be ill; his physical body is still in the present, but he catches a glimpse of something hiding behind a gargoyle on the top of a cathedral. He looks again, but it is gone.

In 1995 London, Orlando has been having fun. We see him in a trashed apartment with dead and mutilated bodes. "Pop Goes the Weasel" is playing on the record player. The phone rings. He answers it and the person on the other line gives him the location of the Invisibles' windmill.

Back in Paris, Etienne asks the Invisibles whether other people can see the group. KM tells him that they're able to be seen, but since their "appearance doesn't fit the consensus reality", the viewers brains would probably rewrite the information so that it makes sense. King Mob tells him Etienne that's not important, asks their guide about the other spirits he had mentioned. Etienne tells him that they're mostly just rumors. There are rumors of the graveyards being visited by "things like insects". King Mob curses, and recognizes that he's talking about Cyphermen- humans whose individuality have been suppressed. KM pulls out a small gun, that he calls "the ghostbuster". According to the Invisible, it will disrupt psychic projections.

The Marquis deSade, a small obese man who walks with a cane, is at a nearby hospital. He is berating the custodians for the poor quality of the healthcare; the living are sometimes sharing beds with the dead, and other indignities. The Marquis walks past a door and hears what sounds like something eating. Thinking it may be the rats, he opens the door to investigate. Instead, it is a group of three Cyphermen seemingly dissecting a woman's corpse.

The scene changes back to Mary Shelley and the mysterious stranger. The stranger remarks that he has recently read "Frankenstein", and also Mary's mother's work, "A Vindication of the Rights of Women", and mentions that he had once met her mother in Paris. Mary tells him that he must have been very young when he met her, but the stranger replies that he is older than he looks. The stranger notices her children, and says that such long travels can be hard on those so young. He then asks her if she's ever heard of the Invisible College. She answers that she's heard rumors of a secret society dedicated to liberty, and asks him why he wants to know. The gentleman responds that humanity needs it's dreamers, but they must never forget that change comes with a price. He tells her to take care, and she points out that he never told her his name. The gentleman simply acknowledges that he has not.

25 years earlier, the Cyphermen are asking the Marquis deSade to feed on the corpse with them. The Marquis becomes greatly agitated and tells himself that what he sees cannot be real, but he is sorely tempted. He moves closer, and is about to fall prey to his dark desires, when King Mob comes bursting in with a yell. He uses his "ghostbuster" on the Cyphermen and manages to disrupt two of them. The third is distracted by Boy, and is soon dispatched by KM. The Marquis is stunned.

After a short interlude showing the horrors of the guillotine and the joy of the spectators, the scene returns to the Invisibles. KM is telling the Marquis that they want to take an astral projection of him into their future. When his physical body dies in the past, it will reunite with the projection in the future. King Mob admits that it sounds ridiculous. deSade is still in shock over what's happened, so King Mob shows him that the corpse that he thought was a young woman was actually that of a rat. The Cyphermen were trying to trap him. Ragged Robin grabs her head and tells the group that they need to hurry up and get back to their time. Something is wrong, and Jack is still physically ill. She tells KM that the enemy has shut down their return gate; they'll have to find another way home. He thinks for a second, and pulls out the postcard of "Arcadia" that came from Orlando. He tells the group to concentrate on the original that is still in his physical body's back pocket, and they should be able to return. There's a whorl around the group, and the Invisibles vanish. Unfortunately, they become separated. King Mob, Boy, and deSade end up in a physical representation of the Arcadia painting with no sign of the others.

Meanwhile, Orlando has entered the Invisible's windmill. He notices Jack and smiles. He pulls out a pair of pruning shears and in a series of panels that are intercut with scenes of guillotine decapitations, Orlando snips off Jack's little finger...
name: Mysteries Of The Guillotine (Arcadia Part 2)

description: Out for revenge on Maxwell Lord, the brother of a terrorist the JLI defeated early in their career appears, with the power to project explosions. He attacks the JLA.
name: Rush to Judgement

description: Part 4 of the 4-part 'Savage Legacy,' continued from the previous issue. The Task Force struggles to stop Vandal Savage's doomsday machine even as its most powerful member, Despero, is lost. And the only hero who can possibly save him is...Gypsy?
name: Down Count

description:
(continued from Detective 682)
Robin and Bock tried to get Bullock to safety as the KGBeast continued his attack. Batman was waiting at Lucious Fox's house when Romana showed up with her men. He quickly dispensed of them and went after KGBeast and the nuke. Robin battled the beast and finally bested him by fighting dirty. Batman arrived and secured the bomb. Bullock was comatose.
name: Troika, Part Four: Big City Bomber

description: More of Manhattan's geriatric citizenry is slain while Dian, sleuthing and seducing, turns up the heat for the Golden Age Sandman.
name: Dr Death: Act 3 of 4

description: Morpheus prepares for battle against the Furies as the Corinthian returns with the missing Daniel. However, is it too late to stop the events set in motion long ago? "The Kindly Ones" part 11.
name: The Kindly Ones, Part 11

description: Part 3 of 3. Stonn's deception puts delicate negotiations in jeopardy while, on the planet 'Gi, Spock attempts to reason with Stonn's rebellious daughter, whose actions have placed her and Spock in mortal danger.
name: Rivals The Conclusion

description: Part 2 of 4. In "The Bajoran and the Beast," Ensign Ro, rescued from her crashed shuttlecraft, becomes the guest of a mysterious benefactor, a hooded being who shows Ro every kindness but will not reveal his identity!
name: The Bajoran And The Beast

description: Barely escaping the forces of Klingon Security, Worf, Riker and Kurn must now survive the dangers of the Nothrian jungles in a deadly race to reach the rebel stronghold of Shadowheart.

volume.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation - Shadowheart

description: With the fall of The Mist, Jack Knight tries putting his life back together. But his attempt to forget Starman proves futile when he receives a disturbing visit from the Golden Age Shade, who reveals strange, hidden facets of Opal City.
name: A Day in the Opal

description: Superboy's legality comes into question by the government. Plus, the master assassin, Copperhead, has been hired to collect a debt of blood from Roxy's father, and the only thing standing in the villain's way is Superboy.
name: Compound Troubles!

description:
Returning to Louisiana, Swamp Thing meets Anna, a mysterious writer with a book of short stories-tales into which the Earth Elemental is irresistibly drawn…one by one.

Swamp Thing encounters a woman named Anna in the Mississippi River, who claims to be the ghost of a tormented writer who committed suicide. She's now trapped inside her unpublished and uncompleted book of short stories, River Run. Each story inside it branches off into an alternate world at certain points of the Mississippi, showing worlds that might've been had history occurred differently. But none of the stories have been able to run correctly, because they lack an element which ties them together. Anna believes that Swamp Thing is supposed to be that element, so he agrees to enter her literary world to help her rest in peace.
name: River Run Prologue: Flotsam and Jetsam

description:
Mrs. Sazia recruits Poison Ivy, Cheshire and Cheetah to kill Paulie Longo. With the help of some of her friends, Diana and Micah set up their new office. She sorts through lots of potential client letters but most of them are garbage. Mr. Longo shows up with some guys and tries to hire her. At first she refuses until Cheshire attacks. Diana fights her and then Ivy arrives for a double team.  
 
Diana tackles Ivy through a window and holds her in the air. She throws Ivy at Cheshire and they both fall to the ground. Diana takes the check Mr. Longo offered her. While flying down to find Ive and Cheshire she realizes she's been badly poisoned by the two of them. She tries to warn a woman in an ally about the danger but that woman ends up being Cheetah and Cheetah attacks.
name: Poison Control!

person_credits.name: Roberta Gregory
person_credits.role: writer, editor, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: After Angela and Spawn are trapped in hell they stumble upon a small demon named Smut who agrees to lead them through the circles to their freedom. Angela returns to Heaven to find her friends Kuan Yin, Anahita and Callindra have built a case to prove that Gabrielle had been conspiring to set up and imprison her on charges of treason.
name: Angela III

description:
We find that Jasper (the boy who got his hand stuck in the portal to the Outback) is still stuck after three weeks. But frees himself with a hacksaw.

The Maxx finds a new Outback that resembles a large blanket fortress filled with toys. In this outback Mr. Gone appears as a wooden toy who defends that realms princess. And we also meet Maxx 2. Instead of a rabbit he is a very big horse.

And in case you hadn’t already guessed Jill was actually Julie, she’s back with a bun in the oven.

As Cyberface escapes from Beast Boy's care, The Dragon, Rapture, and She-Dragon battle the Dragon-Slayer, a robot sent to kill the Dragon by newspaper publisher R. Richard Richards, who maintains a personal hatred for the Dragon. Dragon defeats the Dragon-Slayer, arrests Richards, and returns home to find the Fiend waiting for him.

As the defeated Curse hangs from the walls of Spawn's alley he threatens Spawn and warns him of his vengeance causing the Hellspawn to grow angry. Meanwhile Wanda scours the allies in search of Spawn. She has come to find out why Spawn saved Terry from certain death. When Spawn saves her from a group of thugs (brutally attacked them and nearly killed one of them) she mutters some words of thanks, but can't overcome her fear of him and quickly flees. But she leaves him with a picture of her Terry and their daughter Cyan.
name: Protector

description: Stormwatch actively searches for Synergy, who has been missing for quite some time. She has been kidnapped by Argos, who wants revenge for his defeat at the hands of Stormwatch. She is able to defeat him and find her way back to Skywatch. Meanwhile, Bendix is piecing the puzzle together about the mystery involving Lord Defile and the Daemonites pitting Stormwatch against the WildC.A.T.S.

Extreme Sacrifice Aftermath.

A all-new black haired Supreme lands in Tokyo, with no memories.
name: Extreme Sacrifice, Aftermath

description:
Deathblow escapes custody and radios the other members of Team 7, telling them about the nuke headed their way. Grifter hits on the idea that if they combine their powers, they can form a force field that could protect them from the blast. The team complies and they survive the blast.

Knowing his teammates are safe, Deathblow surrenders to the authorities. When the helicopters arrive to pick up the team, only Lynch boards the chopper.

In the Soviet Union, Commissar Rostov wakes up knowing that something "terrible and magnificent" has happened.

Six months later, Team 7 (minus Lynch) are hiding out in Nicaragua. They have grown tired of hiding from Miles Craven so they decide to head back and start looking for answers.
name: The Furious
